intro: Crepis gemicii, commonly known as the alpine mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and thistles, and is characterized by its small, herbaceous growth habit. The plant produces yellow flowers with ray florets, typically blooming in late summer. It thrives in rocky and alpine environments, often found in meadows and slopes at high altitudes. Crepis gemicii is adapted to cold climates and has a low-growing structure to withstand strong winds and temperature fluctuations.
